verses.kjv: Open thy doors, O Lebanon, that the fire may devour thy cedars.
verses.web: Open your doors, Lebanon, that the fire may devour your cedars.
verses.ct: Throw open your doors, Lebanon, and let fire consume your cedars!

verses.kjv: Howl, fir tree; for the cedar is fallen; because the mighty are spoiled: howl, O ye oaks of Bashan; for the forest of the vintage is come down.
verses.web: Wail, cypress tree, for the cedar has fallen, because the stately ones are destroyed. Wail, you oaks of Bashan, for the strong forest has come down.
verses.ct: Cry out, cypress trees — the mighty cedars have fallen! The great ones are destroyed! Wail, you oaks of Bashan, because the thick forest has been cut down!

verses.kjv: There is a voice of the howling of the shepherds; for their glory is spoiled: a voice of the roaring of young lions; for the pride of Jordan is spoiled.
verses.web: A voice of the wailing of the shepherds! For their glory is destroyed: a voice of the roaring of young lions! For the pride of the Jordan is ruined.
verses.ct: Listen to the shepherds wailing — their glory is ruined! Listen to the young lions roaring — the lush thickets along the Jordan are destroyed!

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD my God; Feed the flock of the slaughter;
verses.web: LORD my God says: “Feed the flock of slaughter.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD my God said to me: "Shepherd the flock that is marked for slaughter."

verses.kjv: Whose possessors slay them, and hold themselves not guilty: and they that sell them say, Blessed be the LORD; for I am rich: and their own shepherds pity them not.
verses.web: Their buyers slaughter them, and go unpunished. Those who sell them say, ‘Blessed be LORD, for I am rich;’ and their own shepherds don’t pity them.
verses.ct: "Their buyers kill them and feel no guilt. Those who sell them say, 'Praise the LORD, I'm getting rich!' Their own shepherds show them no mercy."

verses.kjv: For I will no more pity the inhabitants of the land, saith the LORD: but, lo, I will deliver the men every one into his neighbour’s hand, and into the hand of his king: and they shall smite the land, and out of their hand I will not deliver them.
verses.web: For I will no more pity the inhabitants of the land,” says LORD; “but, behold, I will deliver the men everyone into his neighbor’s hand, and into the hand of his king. They will strike the land, and out of their hand I will not deliver them.”
verses.ct: "I will no longer show mercy to the people of this land," declares the LORD. "Instead, I will hand everyone over to their neighbors and to their king. They will devastate the land, and I will not rescue anyone from their grip."

verses.kjv: And I will feed the flock of slaughter, even you, O poor of the flock. And I took unto me two staves; the one I called Beauty, and the other I called Bands; and I fed the flock.
verses.web: So I fed the flock of slaughter, especially the oppressed of the flock. I took for myself two staffs. The one I called “Favor”, and the other I called “Union”, and I fed the flock.
verses.ct: So I became the shepherd of the flock marked for slaughter — especially the most oppressed among them. I took 2 staffs for myself: one I named Beauty, and the other I named Bands. Then I began shepherding the flock.

verses.kjv: Three shepherds also I cut off in one month; and my soul lothed them, and their soul also abhorred me.
verses.web: I cut off the three shepherds in one month; for my soul was weary of them, and their soul also loathed me.
verses.ct: In a single month I got rid of 3 shepherds. My soul grew impatient with the flock, and they also despised me.

verses.kjv: Then said I, I will not feed you: that that dieth, let it die; and that that is to be cut off, let it be cut off; and let the rest eat every one the flesh of another.
verses.web: Then I said, “I will not feed you. That which dies, let it die; and that which is to be cut off, let it be cut off; and let those who are left eat each other’s flesh.”
verses.ct: Then I said, "I'm done shepherding you. Let the dying die. Let the doomed be destroyed. And let those who are left devour each other."

verses.kjv: And I took my staff, even Beauty, and cut it asunder, that I might break my covenant which I had made with all the people.
verses.web: I took my staff Favor, and cut it apart, that I might break my covenant that I had made with all the peoples.
verses.ct: I took my staff called Beauty and snapped it in two, breaking the covenant I had made with all the peoples.

verses.kjv: And it was broken in that day: and so the poor of the flock that waited upon me knew that it was the word of the LORD.
verses.web: It was broken in that day; and thus the poor of the flock that listened to me knew that it was LORD’s word.
verses.ct: It was broken that very day, and the oppressed of the flock who were watching me recognized that this was the word of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I said unto them, If ye think good, give me my price; and if not, forbear. So they weighed for my price thirty pieces of silver.
verses.web: I said to them, “If you think it best, give me my wages; and if not, keep them.” So they weighed for my wages thirty pieces of silver.
verses.ct: I told them, "If you think it's fair, pay me my wages. If not, keep your money." So they counted out my pay — 30 pieces of silver.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Cast it unto the potter: a goodly price that I was prised at of them. And I took the thirty pieces of silver, and cast them to the potter in the house of the LORD.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “Throw it to the potter, the handsome price that I was valued at by them!” I took the thirty pieces of silver, and threw them to the potter, in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: The LORD said to me, "Throw it to the potter — that magnificent price they thought I was worth!" So I took the 30 pieces of silver and threw them to the potter in the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Then I cut asunder mine other staff, even Bands, that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.
verses.web: Then I cut apart my other staff, even Union, that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.
verses.ct: Then I snapped my other staff, Bands, in two, breaking the bond of brotherhood between Judah and Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Take unto thee yet the instruments of a foolish shepherd.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “Take for yourself yet again the equipment of a foolish shepherd.
verses.ct: The LORD said to me, "Now take up the equipment of a worthless shepherd."

verses.kjv: For, lo, I will raise up a shepherd in the land, which shall not visit those that be cut off, neither shall seek the young one, nor heal that that is broken, nor feed that that standeth still: but he shall eat the flesh of the fat, and tear their claws in pieces.
verses.web: For, behold, I will raise up a shepherd in the land, who will not visit those who are cut off, neither will seek those who are scattered, nor heal that which is broken, nor feed that which is sound; but he will eat the meat of the fat sheep, and will tear their hoofs in pieces.
verses.ct: "Because I am about to raise up a shepherd over the land who won't care for the dying, won't search for the scattered, won't heal the injured, or feed the healthy. Instead, he will gorge himself on the fattest sheep and rip their hooves apart."

verses.kjv: Woe to the idol shepherd that leaveth the flock! the sword shall be upon his arm, and upon his right eye: his arm shall be clean dried up, and his right eye shall be utterly darkened.
verses.web: Woe to the worthless shepherd who leaves the flock! The sword will be on his arm, and on his right eye. His arm will be completely withered, and his right eye will be totally blinded!”
verses.ct: "Disaster will strike the worthless shepherd who abandons the flock! A sword will fall on his arm and on his right eye. His arm will wither completely, and his right eye will go totally blind!"
